message.content:
Certainly! Here is your customized dairy-free and nut-free meal plan that avoids the specified allergens for a week. Please remember to adjust portion sizes according to personal dietary needs and consider consulting with a registered dietitian if you have specific health concerns or requirements:

**Day 1 (Monday):**  
Breakfast - Oatmeal made with oat milk, topped with fresh berries.  
Snack - Carrot sticks and hummus dip.  
Lunch - Grilled chicken breast salad with mixed greens, cherry tomatoes, cucumber, bell peppers, dressed in a balsamic vinaigrette.  
Dinner - Baked salmon fillet with steamed broccoli and quinoa.

**Day 2 (Tuesday):**  
Breakfast - Smoothie made with spinach, banana, frozen mango chunks, flaxseeds, oat milk, and ice.  
Snack - Apple slices.  
Lunch - Turkey wrap using gluten-free tortilla filled with turkey breast, lettuce, shredded carrot, mustard (ensure it's dairy-free), and avocado spread on the side.   
Dinner - Beef stir-fry with an assortment of bell peppers, snap peas, bok choy, served over brown rice or gluten-free noodles. 

**Day 3 (Wednesday):**  
Breakfast - Chia seed pudding made with coconut milk and topped with fresh mango slices.   
Snack - Rice cakes spread with sunflower seed butter or tahini.    
Lunch - Lentil soup cooked in vegetable broth, seasoned with garlic-infused oil (ensure the product is free of allergens), carrots, onions, celery and herbs like thyme and rosemary.   
Dinner - Grilled shrimp skewers with a side salad including mixed greens, cucumbers, cherry tomatoes dressed in olive oil (ensure the dressing is dairy-free). 

**Day 4 (Thursday):**  
Breakfast - Scrambled eggs cooked with turmeric and black salt for an eggless "bacon" flavor. Serve on a slice of gluten-free toast, drizzled with olive oil or avocado spread if desired but avoid honey as sweetener.  
Snack - Orange segments.   
Lunch - Chicken and vegetable skewers (chicken breast pieces marinated in lemon juice and herbs) served alongside a mixed bean salad featuring kidney beans, black beans, corn, diced tomatoes, onions, dressed with lime juice (ensure it's dairy-free).  
Dinner - Roast chicken breast seasoned with rosemary and thyme. Serve with steamed asparagus or green beans. 

**Day 5 (Friday):**   
Breakfast - Banana oat pancakes made from bananas, gluten-free rolled oats, baking powder, vanilla extract; cooked in a non-dairy milk such as rice or soy milk.    
Snack - Sliced cucumber with guacamole (ensure dairy is not included).  
Lunch - Tuna salad using canned tuna packed in water, mixed greens, red onion slices, diced bell peppers; dressing made from olive oil and lemon juice.    
Dinner - Baked cod fillet with a side of roasted Mediterranean vegetables (eggplant, zucchini) drizzled in balsamic glaze or herbs de Provence seasoning.  

**Day 6 (Saturday):**   
Breakfast - Buckwheat porridge made with water and topped with cinnamon; serve with a side of sliced kiwi fruit.    
Snack - Rice crackers with avocado spread on the side, if desired but ensure it's dairy-free (some brands may contain honey).  
Lunch - Quinoa and black bean stuffed peppers; bell peppers filled with cooked quinoa mixed with black beans, tomatoes, corn, seasoning of cumin and paprika.   
Dinner - Grilled teriyaki chicken (ensure the sauce is dairy-free) served over steamed brown rice or gluten-free noodles; side salad includes spinach, shredded carrots with an olive oil vinaigrette dressing made from apple cider vinegar.  

**Day 7 (Sunday):**   
Breakfast - Dairy-free yogurt alternative topped with a mixture of blueberries, strawberries, and kiwi fruit slices; drizzle with fresh lemon juice if desired but avoid honey.  
Snack - Chopped pineapple or mango for some tropical sweetness (ensure no cross-contamination from nuts).   
Lunch - Grilled vegetable skewers including bell peppers, zucchini, and cherry tomatoes with a side of quinoa salad mixed with diced cucumbers, red onion slices, parsley; dressing made by whisking together olive oil, lemon juice (ensure it's dairy-free), minced garlic cloves.   
Dinner - Lemon herb baked salmon fillet with a side of steamed green beans and roasted butternut squash cubes; drizzle the dish with fresh orange zest for flavor (ensure it's dairy-free).  

This meal plan offers variety while taking into account your allergies to certain food items. Please always read labels carefully, as ingredients can change and might contain hidden sources of your specific allergenic substances. It is crucial to have clear communication with any restaurant when dining out or choosing prepared meals from grocery stores regarding the absence of dairy products and nuts in particular items due to cross-contamination concerns, as well as ensuring that garlic and honey are not present in dressings.
